intro: Zygophyllum fabago subsp. brachypterum, commonly known as the narrow-winged sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 cm. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Its flowers are yellow or orange and are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. This species is well-suited to sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland dunes.
